issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I tried to run nodeadmin-unpack-instance on a centos6 and centos7 NC configured with ceph-rbd block storage and I received the following error(s):
First error:
{code}
/bin/tar: Removing leading `/' from member names
Found rbd as protocol in connection string
Unable to open ceph keyring file /etc/ceph/ceph.client.eucalyptus.keyring.
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/sbin/nodeadmin-unpack-instance", line 329, in <module>
    sys.exit(main(args, log_level))
  File "/usr/sbin/nodeadmin-unpack-instance", line 319, in main
    rc = unpack_instance(instance_tuple[1], args.packed_file)
  File "/usr/sbin/nodeadmin-unpack-instance", line 282, in unpack_instance
    _attach_volumes(instance_path)
  File "/usr/sbin/nodeadmin-unpack-instance", line 252, in _attach_volumes
    volume_serial, volume_bus, connection_string)
  File "/usr/sbin/nodeadmin-unpack-instance", line 206, in _attach_iscsi_target
    rc = check_call(iscsi_pl_cmd)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/subprocess.py", line 505, in check_call
    raise CalledProcessError(retcode, cmd)
subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command '['/usr/share/eucalyptus/connect_iscsitarget.pl', u'/,vol-59b4a9e9,vda,euca-bdm-ebs1-dev-vda,virtio,eucalyptus,/etc/ceph/ceph.client.eucalyptus.keyring,/etc/ceph/ceph.conf,rbd,ceph,,,eucaqa/vol-59b4a9e9,65673e83-e00b-448f-88c1-758da6bd5b48,,,']' returned non-zero exit status 1
{code}
I copied the keyring file /etc/ceph/ceph.client.demouser.keyring to the eucalyptus keyring file the script was looking for.  I then received the error below.
{code}
/bin/tar: Removing leading `/' from member names
Found rbd as protocol in connection string
Virsh secret is not associated with the configured user. Resetting the virsh secret
Failed to run 'virsh secret-set-value 65673e83-e00b-448f-88c1-758da6bd5b48 --base64 ': error: expected syntax: --base64 <string>
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/sbin/nodeadmin-unpack-instance", line 329, in <module>
    sys.exit(main(args, log_level))
  File "/usr/sbin/nodeadmin-unpack-instance", line 319, in main
    rc = unpack_instance(instance_tuple[1], args.packed_file)
  File "/usr/sbin/nodeadmin-unpack-instance", line 282, in unpack_instance
    _attach_volumes(instance_path)
  File "/usr/sbin/nodeadmin-unpack-instance", line 252, in _attach_volumes
    volume_serial, volume_bus, connection_string)
  File "/usr/sbin/nodeadmin-unpack-instance", line 206, in _attach_iscsi_target
    rc = check_call(iscsi_pl_cmd)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/subprocess.py", line 505, in check_call
    raise CalledProcessError(retcode, cmd)
subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command '['/usr/share/eucalyptus/connect_iscsitarget.pl', u'/,vol-59b4a9e9,vda,euca-bdm-ebs1-dev-vda,virtio,eucalyptus,/etc/ceph/ceph.client.eucalyptus.keyring,/etc/ceph/ceph.conf,rbd,ceph,,,eucaqa/vol-59b4a9e9,65673e83-e00b-448f-88c1-758da6bd5b48,,,']' returned non-zero exit status 1
{code}
Full verbose output
{code}
[root@c-25 ceph]# nodeadmin-unpack-instance ./nc-backup/i-2c80aab3-pack.tgz --verbose
DEBUG: Your Arguments: Namespace(packed_file='./nc-backup/i-2c80aab3-pack.tgz', verbose=True)
DEBUG: nc_status is
INFO: unpack on ./nc-backup/i-2c80aab3-pack.tgz
ERROR: ./nc-backup/i-2c80aab3-pack.tgz not found
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/sbin/nodeadmin-unpack-instance", line 329, in <module>
    sys.exit(main(args, log_level))
  File "/usr/sbin/nodeadmin-unpack-instance", line 314, in main
    raise NodeAdminUnpackError("%s not found", args.packed_file)
__main__.NodeAdminUnpackError: ('%s not found', './nc-backup/i-2c80aab3-pack.tgz')
[root@c-25 ceph]# cd
[root@c-25 ~]# nodeadmin-unpack-instance ./nc-backup/i-2c80aab3-pack.tgz --verbose
DEBUG: Your Arguments: Namespace(packed_file='./nc-backup/i-2c80aab3-pack.tgz', verbose=True)
DEBUG: nc_status is
INFO: unpack on ./nc-backup/i-2c80aab3-pack.tgz
/bin/tar: Removing leading `/' from member names

fields.summary: nodeadmin-unpack-instance fails when trying to unpack on ceph cloud

comments.body: If the keyring file was not present what else was not configured correctly with ceph?
Corrected where ceph configuration is pulled from for perl scripts instead of just using defaults.

Verified.  I was able to pack/unpack on the same NC and remote NC.
{code}
[root@c-25 ~]# rpm -qi eucalyptus-nc
Name        : eucalyptus-nc                Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 4.3.0                             Vendor: Hewlett Packard Enterprise
Release     : 0.25010.343.20160628gitcb817f6.el6   Build Date: Tue 28 Jun 2016 05:29:17 PM PDT
Install Date: Wed 29 Jun 2016 10:26:59 AM PDT      Build Host: euca-10-111-54-63
Group       : Applications/System           Source RPM: eucalyptus-4.3.0-0.25010.343.20160628gitcb817f6.el6.src.rpm
Size        : 4001781                          License: GPLv3
Signature   : (none)
URL         : http://www.eucalyptus.com
Summary     : Eucalyptus cloud platform - node controller
Description :
Eucalyptus is a service overlay that implements elastic computing
using existing resources. The goal of Eucalyptus is to allow sites
with existing clusters and server infrastructure to co-host an elastic
computing service that is interface-compatible with Amazon AWS.

This package contains the node controller part of eucalyptus. This
component handles instances.
{code}
